questions.question: What are probiotics?
choices: Live microorganisms that confer health benefits when consumed
Chemicals that kill bacteria in the gut
Non-digestible food ingredients that promote bacterial growth
questions.answer: Live microorganisms that confer health benefits when consumed

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common probiotic strain?
questions.answer: Escherichia coli

questions.question: What are prebiotics?
choices: Non-digestible food ingredients that promote growth of beneficial gut bacteria
questions.answer: Non-digestible food ingredients that promote growth of beneficial gut bacteria

questions.question: Which of the following is a prebiotic fiber?
questions.answer: Inulin

questions.question: What is the primary use of fecal microbiota transplantation (FMT)?
choices: Treatment of recurrent Clostridioides difficile infections
questions.answer: Treatment of recurrent Clostridioides difficile infections

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a potential risk of FMT?

choices: A combination of probiotics and prebiotics

questions.question: What is the concept behind microbiome-friendly medications?
choices: Medications that kill all bacteria in the gut
Drugs designed to minimize disruption to beneficial microbiota
Medications that increase inflammation in the gut
questions.answer: Drugs designed to minimize disruption to beneficial microbiota

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a microbiome-friendly medication approach?
questions.answer: Narrow-spectrum antibiotics

questions.question: What is the purpose of using beta-lactamase enzymes alongside antibiotics?
choices: To increase the potency of antibiotics
To degrade antibiotics in the gut, preserving beneficial bacteria
To stimulate the growth of harmful bacteria
To improve the taste of antibiotics
questions.answer: To degrade antibiotics in the gut, preserving beneficial bacteria
